title: Windows Event Analysis
description:
A Windows Security Event Log shows these entries:

Event ID: 4625 | Logon Type: 10 | Account: Administrator | Source IP: 10.10.14.50 | Time: 09:01:00
Event ID: 4625 | Logon Type: 10 | Account: Administrator | Source IP: 10.10.14.50 | Time: 09:01:02
Event ID: 4625 | Logon Type: 10 | Account: Administrator | Source IP: 10.10.14.50 | Time: 09:01:04
Event ID: 4624 | Logon Type: 10 | Account: Administrator | Source IP: 10.10.14.50 | Time: 09:01:06
Event ID: 4672 | Account: Administrator | Time: 09:01:06

Event ID 4625 = Failed logon, 4624 = Successful logon, 4672 = Special privileges assigned.
Logon Type 10 = RemoteInteractive (RDP).

What happened here? How many failed attempts preceded the successful login?

Submit as: flag{number}
hints: Three failures then a success suggests a brute force or password guessing
The 4672 event means the account has admin privileges
